text: Wine \add is\add* a mocker, strong drink a brawler,
and any who go astray by it are not wise.
Roaring like the lion \add is the\add* dreaded anger of a king;
he who provokes him forfeits his life.\f + \fr 20:2 \ft Or “soul,” or “inner self” \f*
\add It is\add* honorable for the man to refrain from strife,
but every fool will be quick to quarrel.
The lazy person will not plow in season;
he will expect at the harvest, but there \add will be\add* nothing.
Deep waters \add are like\add* purpose in the heart\f + \fr 20:5 \ft Or “mind” \f* of a man,
and a man of understanding will draw it\f + \fr 20:5 \ft Or “her”; referring to “purpose” \f* out.
Many a person will proclaim his loyalty \add for\add* himself,
but a man \add who is\add* trustworthy, who can find?
He who walks in his integrity \add is\add* righteous;
happy are his children who follow him.
A king who sits on \add the\add* throne of judgment
winnows all evil with his eyes.
Who will say “I have made my heart\f + \fr 20:9 \ft Or “mind” \f* clean;
I am pure from my sin”?
Stone and stone, measure and measure,
⸤both of them⸥\f + \fr 20:10 \ft Literally “also \fq the \ft two of them” \f* \add are\add* an abomination of Yahweh.
Even by his acts, a ⸤young man⸥\f + \fr 20:11 \ft Or “young boy,” or “adolescent” \f* will make himself known,
whether his acts are pure and upright.
The ear that hears and the eye that sees,
Yahweh has made ⸤them both⸥.\f + \fr 20:12 \ft Literally “also \fq the \ft two of them” \f*
Do not love sleep, lest you become poor;
open your eyes \add and\add* have plenty bread.
“Bad, bad,” the buyer will say,
but \add when\add* one goes to him, then he will boast.
There is gold and many costly stones,
but precious jewels are lips of knowledge.
Take his garment, for he has given security \add to\add* a stranger,
and on behalf of a foreigner—take it as pledge.
Bread gained by deceit is sweet for the man,
but afterward, his mouth will be filled \add with\add* gravel.
A plan\f + \fr 20:18 \ft Hebrew “plans” \f* will be established by advice,
and with guidance make war.
He reveals a secret, he who walks \add about with\add* gossip,
and do not associate with a babbler’s lips.
He who curses his father and his mother,
his lamp will be extinguished ⸤in the midst of darkness⸥.\f + \fr 20:20 \ft Literally “in a pupil of darkness” \f*
An inheritance acquired \add hastily\add* ⸤at the beginning⸥\f + \fr 20:21 \ft Literally “at the first” \f*
will not be blessed at its end.
Do not say “I will repay evil”;
wait for Yahweh and he will deliver you.
An abomination of Yahweh \add is\add* ⸤a stone and a weight⸥,\f + \fr 20:23 \ft Literally “a stone and a stone” \f*
and scales of falsehood are not good.
\add Away\add* from Yahweh are the steps of a strong man,
and how will humankind understand his ways?
\add It is\add* a snare to humankind to say rashly “\add It is\add* holy,”
and after vows, to scrutinize.
A wise king winnows the wicked,
and he will drive a wheel over them.
The lamp of Yahweh \add is\add* the spirit\f + \fr 20:27 \ft Or “soul” \f* of humankind,
he who searches every ⸤innermost part⸥.\f + \fr 20:27 \ft Literally “parts of the inmost” \f*
Loyalty and faithfulness will preserve a king,
and he is upheld with the righteousness of his throne.
The glory of young men \add is\add* their strength,\f + \fr 20:29 \ft Or “strengthens them” \f*
but the beauty of the aged \add is\add* gray hair.
The blows of a wound will cleanse evil,
as will\f + \fr 20:30 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* beatings of the ⸤innermost part⸥.\f + \fr 20:30 \ft Literally “parts of the inmost” \f*
